shortdesc.ph: DITA-OT 3.2 supports a new plug-in registry that makes it easier to discover and install new plug-ins. The registry provides a searchable list of plug-ins at .

section.p: In the past, installing plug-ins required you to either download a plug-in to your computer and provide the path to the plug-in archive (.zip file) or pass the URL of the plug-in distribution file to the dita command and let DITA-OT download the file. This required that you know the URL of the plug-in distribution package.

section.title: Installing plug-ins from the registry
section.p: With the registry, you can now search the list of available plug-ins at and install new plug-ins by name and optional version.
Search the registry for a plug-in and install it by providing the plug-in name to the dita command.

If the plug-in requires other plug-ins, those are also installed recursively.

If a matching plug-in cannot be found, an error message will appear. Possible reasons for failure include:

ul.li: A plug-in with the specified name was not found in the registry
A plug-in with the specified version was not found in the registry
The specified plug-in version is not compatible with the installed DITA-OT version
None of the available plug-in versions are compatible with the installed DITA-OT version

section.title: Publishing plug-ins to the registry
section.p: The main plug-in registry lives in https://github.com/dita-ot/registry. New plug-ins or new versions are added by creating a PR that add the plug-in entry in JSON format. The entries are named <plugin-name>.json. The contents of the entry file is an array of plug-in version entries.
Structure of the plug-in version entries:

row.entry: Array of dependency entries. The only mandatory plug-in dependency is org.dita.base which defines the supported DITA-OT platform.
Absolute URL to plug-in distribution file
SHA-256 hash of the plug-in distribution file
Required plug-in version in SemVer format that may contain ranges.

section.title: Adding custom registries
section.p: Configuration file config/configuration.properties has key registry that is a space separated list of registry URLs. Add custom registries into the registry key value.
